intro: Parodiophyllochloa pantricha, commonly known as the Pantricha grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typical of the Poaceae family. Parodiophyllochloa pantricha is often found in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat.
